show.subtitle: Your Economic Survival?  They're Not Looking Out For You.  We are.
show.title: The Wake Up Call

header.title: The Internet, Per Se, Does Not Contribute To the Economy

title: The Internet, Per Se, Does Not Contribute To the Economy
content:
The current internet boom is a chimera. It is mostly about redistributing existing demand from offline to online. <!--more--> It won’t inflict damage because the amount of financing required to support it is minimal but it offers false hope that it can revive economies.
Bitcoin is the poster child of the Internet fantasy.
No internet activity changes the production machine behind goods and services.
Only new ones can move the economy forward.
Stock market report: margin debt.
Richard Duncan talking about the stock market.
Nigeria’s accounting legerdemain increased the size of its GDP by 89% over the weekend!
The European Central Bank is also engaged in funny tricks to create most of its profits.
The US does exactly the same thing.
A brief comment on my theme-of-the-year: War with China.
The NSA’s data collection is just plain ineffective.
The US government can’t possibly use all the information it collects.
US interest payments are growing monstrously, now comprising a quarter of total tax takings!
Private equity and hedge funds are now reducing dramatically their purchases of real estate, in line with my own predictions.
Purchasers for Obamacare have signed up for unsustainably cheap medical insurance.
They will incur far more in medical costs than they will pay in premiums.
Insurance companies will have to be bailed out.
You’ll see… You heard it here first!
